name: Felipe Frantz Zanini
description: Senior Software Engineer in Pelotas, Brazil

about.title: About
about.description:
My path in software development began in 2008, during my technical course. In 2010, I completed the program and started my first programming internship — I have been working and growing in the field ever since. Hired as a software engineer that same year, I have worked on more than 90 projects, using languages such as PHP, JavaScript, Ruby, Python and other languages and libraries. I am currently a senior software engineer at Iguatemi S.A.
Driven by a passion for technology and a commitment to continuous improvement, I completed a degree in Information Technology Management, a postgraduate specialisation in Strategic IT Planning, and began a Master's in Computer Science, which I did not complete for personal reasons. In light of advances in technology and artificial intelligence, I began a postgraduate degree in AI and automation, to stay aligned with market demands and continue growing in my career.

information.title: Senior Software Engineer & Tech Lead at nav9 ➚
information.description: Responsible for developing frontend projects for the company's clients, also acting as consultant and technical lead. I apply best practices and clean code for leading companies in the Brazilian market, such as Shoppings Iguatemi, UFC, EducaCross, Grupo SEB, and Rede AZ, among others. I use React, Next, and TypeScript as my main technologies to deliver innovation and quality to the projects I work on.

information.title: CAPES Master's Scholar at UFPel ➚
information.description: Responsible for extending the simulator developed and used by the research group for modelling and simulation of Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs). Using real data collected by traps designed by the group, we simulated their behaviour in natural environments, obtaining information on battery life, data collection capacity, communication range between traps, and coverage. The Eboracum simulator was developed and extended mainly in Java. This work led to two scientific papers: one on performance and energy consumption and another on WSN simulation and modelling.

information.title: Founder & CTO at Alpago ➚
information.description: ALPAGO was created to support the organisation and communication of the sheep farming production chain, addressing two long-standing problems in the sector. In 2016, the startup was incubated at Conectar and, in 2017, graduated from the Inovativa Brasil programme, standing out for its relevance. The sustainability of sheep farming depends on actions that systemically coordinate every link in the chain. I was responsible for system development, including requirements gathering, feasibility assessment, documentation, design, development, methodology selection, and testing. I also engaged with users and partners to gather feedback and deliver ongoing value to the community. Main technologies: PHP with CodeIgniter, HTML5, CSS3 with Bootstrap, JavaScript, and MySQL.

information.title: Software Engineer at ZapShop Informática ➚
information.description:
Responsible for client support in the development area: analysis of proposed systems, documentation, and development of custom solutions. I also delivered training for clients and new team members, and carried out testing and system maintenance.
Main technologies: Visual Basic, PHP with CodeIgniter, Laravel and CakePHP, HTML5, CSS3 with Bootstrap and Material-UI, JavaScript, and MySQL.

information.title: Postgraduate in Artificial Intelligence and Automation at RocketSeat ➚
Master's in Computer Science at UFPel ➚
Postgraduate Specialisation in IT Management at IDEAU ➚
Bachelor's Degree in IT Management at URCAMP ➚
Technical Course in Computing at URCAMP ➚
JavaScript
information.desciption: Over the past five years, I have focused on this programming language. I use it for frontend development with React, mainly with Next.js — and Vite often joins the party — and have worked on projects with Angular and Vue. When it's time for the backend, Node.js and Express are my go-to duo. I also use it to improve test automation with Jest.

information.title: PHP
information.desciption: I have extensive experience in my "first" programming language, with over ten years of practice. Throughout my career, I have used and continue to use PHP in a variety of applications: APIs and large-scale systems with CodeIgniter and Laravel, as well as relational (MySQL) and non-relational (MongoDB) databases.
